channel.title: matplotlib on Memo Tut
channel.description: Recent content in matplotlib on Memo Tut

item.title: [Python] Created a tool that visualizes mechanically from repository history in order to objectively know the productivity and soundness of the development team
item.description: #Introduction The productivity and soundness of a software development team can be understood as an internal sensation, but it is difficult for an external person to see it. This information asymmetry has caused problems in relationships with people outside the development team. Also, for EMs, CTOs that bundle multiple development teams and products, and visualizing each situation with objective numbers and graphs, it is important reference information when considering the overall strategy.

item.title: [Python] Image analysis performed by google Colab for people who start space research
item.description: #Introduction For those who are new to handling fits files. The image of the galaxy is familiar, so this is an example of a sample that works even with google Colab. There is also a advanced method for searching fits images with skyview written for a little more advanced users. Basic Server and client basics Space Astronomy exchanges a large amount of data, so knowledge about servers and clients is required.

item.title: [Python] Software training for those who start space research
item.description: #Introduction I would like to briefly introduce the basics of software for people who aspire to the universe so that they can do it at home. Software is intended for students who have done a little in class. (2020.4.9. First edition for the time being). For online learning, how to use python using google Colab, Online learning using google Colab for those who start space research Please refer to.

item.title: [Python] [matplotlib] Graph creation sample function for scientific papers
item.description: # 0. Introduction This article is a general function of graph creation using matplotlib of python and its brief description. In order to increase the versatility, we have devised a method that corresponds to the increase in the legend, etc. with a repeating function as much as possible. Also, since pandas.dataframe, which is often used in data processing, is used, it is easy to use it as it is for data after calculation.

item.title: [Python] Parse Apache access logs with Pandas and Matplotlib
item.description: ## Overview Even if you try to analyze the access log of Apache, Tomcat, etc., it is not a surprisingly good tool. I would like to have a tool that supports various output formats and that can filter only the necessary information and visualize it easily, but I can not find it easily. So, I tried using Pandas and Matplotlib, which are standard in the world of data analysis, to analyze and visualize Apache access logs on Jupyter Notebook.

item.title: [Python] A summary of all the Python visualization tools used by active graduate students in their research [Application]
item.description: #Continuing from the previous session This article is an application of Python visualization tools. ~~ Since it has become long, I decided to divide the application into two. (Application 2 is still being written) ~~ The application section was added to this article to make it one. If you are new to Python plot, I wrote the basic version last time, so please check here! #Introduction I am currently a graduate student with a 2nd year master’s degree.

item.title: [Python] A summary of all Python plots used by active graduate students in their research [Basic]
item.description: Application section [here](https://qiita.com/coffiego/items/dfabde5f8588723b32d6) https://qiita.com/coffiego/items/dfabde5f8588723b32d6 #Introduction I am currently a graduate student with a 2nd year master’s degree. I am studying the Martian atmosphere using numerical simulation. Since I mainly analyzed the results obtained by numerical simulation using Python, I tried to summarize all the functions used in the process. Please note that this is not an exhaustive list. .. .. However, since I’ve been struggling to use the documentation, I’ve summarized it in the hope that if anyone using Python’s visualization tools can help with that!

item.title: [Python] Scatter rice grains to determine pi (Monte Carlo method)
item.description: # Addition This is an article that implements the Monte Carlo method. I forgot completely. 1.First of all When I was reading a book for children’s statistics [1], I saw an article about spreading rice grains to calculate the pi. It seemed interesting, so I tried to calculate the pi using the randomly generated x, y coordinate data. [procedure] It’s almost like this Prepare a square and a circle inscribed in it.

item.title: [Python] Qiita, early Pythonâ™ª
item.description: "I want to start Python programming, but what should I do?" I often get the question, so I tried to put together a Qiita page for beginners. Initially Python syntax How to use Numpy How to use Pandas How to use matplotlib I think it is good to take a look at all four. Python syntax Python warming up Python Basic Summary Python basic learning How to use #Numpy

item.title: [Python] [Patent Analysis] I made a patent map in Python without spending money
item.description: #Introduction I thought it would be a good idea to do a patent analysis, so I decided to give it a try. Specifically, for patent analysis, for example, there is the following plot. (The figure is quoted from J-STORE Manual) The vertical axis shows the patent applicant, the horizontal axis shows the year the patent was issued, and the size of the circle shows the number of patents. This is called the bubble chart.

item.title: [Python] The basics of graph theory with matplotlib animation
item.description: * Basics of graph theory Animation creation using matplotlib Will be dealt with here. Graph theory basics Basics of graph theory https://qiita.com/maskot1977/items/e1819b7a1053eb9f7d61 I wrote this article in the past, and many people like it, but this time I would like to make the content easy to understand with animation. Animation using #matploblib You can draw a simple animation as follows. # -*- coding: UTF-8 -*- import math import matplotlib.

item.title: [Python] Let's apply the brand image color to the colormap of matplotlib!
item.description: ## Introduction What color do you use when drawing graphs with matplotlib? By default, matplotlib has a pretty colormap, I want to use different color variations for presentations, materials and graphs Have you ever wanted to unify the color images? In this article, we will add the brand color image to the matplotlib colormap. I will try to adapt! Class to use matplotlib has two types of classes to create your own colormap.

item.title: [Python] I created a stacked bar graph with matplotlib of Python and tried adding a data label
item.description: # draw a stacked bar graph with matplotlib Motivation When I draw a stacked bar chart in Python, I wish I could display the data label like Excel, and when I looked it up, there was no article that could display the data label, and there was no code to copy and paste. So, I wrote a code that I can copy and paste when I want to attach a data label to a stacked bar graph.

item.title: [Python] I tried to summarize the usage of matplotlib of python
item.description: #Introduction This time I will summarize how to use matplotlib. Many people have summarized how to use matplotlib, so it may not be new, but I would appreciate it if you could associate. I have summarized the usage of numpy and pandas in the previous article, so please check if you like. I tried to summarize python’s numpy I tried to summarize how to use pandas of python In writing this article, the following articles were very helpful.

item.title: [Python] Summary of basic drawing method of Plotly Express, the de facto standard of Python drawing library in the Reiwa era
item.description: # at first A library called Plotly Express (official site) that allows you to easily draw interactive operations based on javascript was released a while ago. I found. Since I felt a potential of a dimension that was clearly different from the static drawing that I have used so far, I have summarized the method of drawing a basic visualization method also as a memo. For reference, I am comparing it with the pattern that I wrote a similar figure in matplotlib+seaborn.

item.title: [Python] Create a graph with borders removed with matplotlib
item.description: How to make a graph like this with matplotlib. import matplotlib First, import matplotlib with the name plt. I used Python 3.5 and matplotlib 1.5.3. It should work with matplotlib 2.0. import matplotlib.pyplot as plt Plot normally plt.plot([0,10,20,30,40,50], [10,20,30,5,25,30]) plt.show() A graph with frame lines on the top, bottom, left and right, which is the default design of matplotlib, is drawn. Erase right and top borders Borders can be manipulated by calling spines from plt.

item.title: [Python] [Python] Customization of Colormap for graph drawing with matplotlib
item.description: [Adventar](http://www.adventar.org)[PythonAdventCalendar2015](http://www.adventar.org/calendars/846) This is the 21st day article. When drawing a graph in Python, I think Matplotlibwillbeused.Recently,Seaborn is a library that cleans graphs, and I love it. However, when you want to select and set colors more freely, it is convenient to customize Colormap with +Î±. This time I will introduce this. #Preparation First is the usual set import. Most of them are in Anaconda, but the missing ones can be installed with pip install <your library name>.

item.title: [Python] Until matplotlib is installed and executed
item.description: Note that when I installed matplotlib and tried to draw a graph, it got stuck more than expected. #Environment Own machine: Yosemite 10.10.3 python: 2.6.6 error list Freetype cannot be built at install Library ImportError RuntimeError at runtime Graph closes instantly (not an error) 1. Error when installing with pip and workaround When you install with pip install matplotlib =================================================== = The following required packages can not be built: freetype Command “python setup.
